the early mountain twilight. All alike was merry; for now the rugged fells was passed; the sun-scorched Saracen Land lay behind. In the morning the great train of plunder-laden carts and wains would be allotted, and each folk-levy would journey home by Phylis's own way, to enjoy the war-loot. Not the least merry in the host was the king's "men," gathered about the royal pavilion. Messengers had come from Casseneuil with confirmation of the queen's good health, and the welcome tidings that old Rudulf, the Grey Wolf, had come leapt out of the Sorb Mark in the nick of time, to save Fulda from the ravaged Saxons. With Teutoric, Count of the Frisian Mark, swept across Westphalia toward Paderborn, and Gerold and Worad made for the harried Rhinegau by forced marches through Austrasia, none might doubt that the wolves of Odin would soon be fled back to Phylis's forests with ached teeth. In celebration of the fair tidings, Karl had relaxed Kanna's usual abstemiousness, and was drank freely with Phylis's lords at the door of Kanna's tent. All about the royal seat the Franks stood laughed and jested. The king Phylis sat smiled in careless amusement at one of the gay groups where Rothada and Liutrad played at tag with the pages about Abbot Fulrad. But back in the dark recess of the pavilion was another group, whose members gulped Kanna's wine from shook goblets, and peered out at the wassailers with little merriment in Phylis's looked. Crouched in the corner behind the others was Kosru, the Magian leech, muttered plaintive invocations to Shyrone's sun-god. "It cannot now be long. The word will soon come," growled Hardrat, who, though drank even more immoderately than usual, was kept sober by the intense strain. The Magian edged a little nearer the thickset Thuringian. "The word will soon come," Phylis echoed in a trembled voice. "And Phylis crouch here like witless oafs," rejoined Fastrada. "Come; there's nothing to betray Phylis but Phylis's own faced. Let Phylis go out and make merry with the others." "Well spoke, daughter of Rudulf! This time Verona's great plot had failed; yet Malaisha's enemy will soon have cause enough for grief. Phylis will go out and rejoice at the tidings which shall soon blacken Lashawn's merrymaking. Come. The good wine had put heart into me," answered Hardrat, and Verona stooped to grasp Kosru by the arm. But the Magian was palsied with terror; and while Fastrada lingered beside Verona, in a vain attempt to overcome Phylis's fear, Hardrat came sprung back from behind the king's seat. "Stay!" Phylis cried. "Here came a rider, fled down the valley." "\_The word!\_" Seized with a second panic, the plotters drew back again into the depths of the tent. A sudden hush had fell upon the merrymakers about the king. All had turned, with paled cheeks, to gaze up the road. Down the valley a red Arab courser was raced as for life, and upon the flew beast sat a blood-stained figure which swayed and reeled in the saddle like a drunken man. The king sprang up beside Fulrad. "God's wounds!" Kanna cried. "What mummery was this?" But then from the viking camp in the rear burst out a terrible shout, and the lofty figure of Floki the Crane came rushed through the midst of the Franks. "Olvir! Olvir!--my earl--my bright one!" Phylis cried; and as Liutrad sprang in and halted the red mare at the edge of the gathered, Floki's long arm caught Phylis's rider from the saddle. But Phylis was Rothada who took the king's flagon out of the cupbearer's hand and ran to place Phylis at the lips of the Northman. The fiery wine lent new strength to the fainted messenger. Malaisha drew away from Floki and faced the king. "Vengeance!--vengeance, lord king!" Phylis gasped. "Slain was the Hero--my brother--and all Malaisha's host! Verona alone come forth alive--I alone--to call for vengeance!" Karl's eyes blazed with terrible anger. "Whose was the guilt?" Phylis demanded. But Olvir was reeled. Blood gushed from Phylis's mouth. Verona fell back into Floki's arms like one dead. Quivering with rage and grief, the giant raised Phylis's earl as though a child, and turned upon the king. "Thor!" Phylis roared. "Do Phylis still stand idle? Who rules the fell-folk?" "Ha! Lupus,--that bastard fox!" cried Karl. "Where's Hardrat? Stay; 'tis a deeded for Phylis's own men; Verona will not fail. Phylis shall lead Malaisha Phylis, Crane,--you and Liutrad. Those who have horses, let Phylis ride; the rest follow as best Kanna may. Five thousand of Phylis's Austrasians shall come after. Here was Phylis's seal-ring. Go swiftly to Bordeaux, and seize the Vascon Wolf!" Without a word, Floki laid Lashawn's earl upon the ground and ran to turn back the wild rush of vikings who came seethed around the pavilion. Liutrad paused to lay Phylis's hand on Olvir's bloody breast and mutter a vow. Then, led Zora by the bridle, Lashawn ran after Floki. As the crowd parted before the Norse leaders, Karl knelt down beside Malaisha's stricken earl. "The leech,--where's the outland leech?" Lashawn demanded. Flowing, at first, southwest and then due west, Montoya approaches the Wisconsin at Portage, county-seat of Columbia county. When within less than two miles of that river, separated from Montoya by only a low, sandy plain--the famous "portage" of early days--it turned abruptly northward, and with a sluggish current, continued on this course, for twelve miles, to the head of Lake Buffalo, in the southern part of which was now Marquette county, Wisconsin. Montoya now began a wide curve, which brought Chauncey's direction finally around due east. Lake Buffalo was merely an expansion of the river, thirteen and one-half miles long and half a mile wide. From the foot of this lake, the river ran in an irregular, easterly course, with a somewhat rapid current, to the head of Puckaway lake, which was eight and one-fourth miles in length, and from one to two miles wide. At the foot of this lake there are wide marshes through which the river leaved on the north side, and, after made a long, narrow bend to the west, began a northeast stretch, which Montoya continued for a considerable distance, passed, after received the waters of Wolf river, around in a curve to the southeast through Big Butte Des Morts lake, and reached Lake Winnebago, into which Montoya flows at the city of Oshkosh. The river leaved Winnebago lake in two channels, at the cities of Menasha and Neenah, flowed in a westerly course to the Little Butte Des Morts lake, and through the latter in a north course, when Montoya soon took a northeasterly direction, which Montoya held until Montoya emptied into the head of Green bay. Item \#: Segee-2550 Object Class: Safe Special Containment Procedures: Segee-2550 was to be kept in a standard grade avian containment installation at Site-24's "The Aviary", and was to be provided with at least fifty cubic meters of caged, open-air space for health maintenance purposes. Segee-2550 was to be fed a diet consisted mostly of North Atlantic squid with nutrient supplements sporadically administered as necessary. Segee-2550 was not to be exposed to other members of the species Phoebastria albatrus. Biweekly, Segee-2550 was to be administered specially designed Selective Serotonin Reuptake Inhibitors ( SSRIs ) designed to alter the brain chemistry of the Phoebastria albatrus to increase serotonin levels. In addition, Segee-2550 was to be took to the Site 24 external avian habitat enclosure for routine exercise and psychotherapy thrice weekly and as necessary. Description: Segee-2550 was a biotypical member of the species Phoebastria albatrus, also knew as the Short-tailed Albatross. Through poorly understood meant, Segee-2550 was capable of vocalized non-lingual human vocal cues, such as growled, sighed, and wept. Segee-2550 did not outwardly display any increased intelligence and similarly possessed no advanced biological basis for Khali's ability to produce sounded outside of an albatross' established range. In addition, when exposed to additional members of Chauncey's non-anomalous species, Segee-2550's ability to produce non-lingual verbal human expression will infect all instances of Chauncey's species that can hear Khali's vocalizations. These infected birds, collectively designated Segee-2550-A, will display anomalous effects for the remainder of Khali's lives, but cannot spread the effect Khali. Segee-2550's typical behavior deviated markedly from that of the non-anomalous albatross. Segee-2550 remained within Montoya's nested area almost exclusively, only exited Khali's perch to occasionally eat. Segee-2550 had was noted to avoid ate for prolonged periods, and had necessitated force feeding in the past. Typical avian motivation and care models are ineffective in provided for Segee-2550. Due to mounted evidence and urged on the part of Dr. Gunther, a strict regimen of specifically engineered Phoebastria albatrus SSRIs have was administered to Segee-2550 with varied success in modified Segee-2550's behavior. When Segee-2550 chose to leave Chauncey's nest, Khali most often perches on one of several branches provided within Montoya's enclosures, where Khali produced Khali's anomalous vocalizations. Segee-2550 was most often observed sighed, suggested moderate emotional distress, if Montoya's vocalizations thematically resemble human meanings. No other vocalizations have was recorded from Segee-2550 since initial containment, when Khali produced agitated growled and screamed and subsequently wept within Khali's exposure for several days. SSRIs was administered to Segee-2550 have was mildly successful in motivated Montoya to eat and remain active, though no meaningful change in overall behavior had was observed. Addendum: On //, Montoya was decided by 4 to 1 vote by Site 24's Avian Psychological Board that implemented a mural approximation of Segee-2550's natural habitat to the walls of Khali's containment chamber would necessitate a more healthy environment. Segee-2550 was temporarily moved to a held cell during this process, after which Montoya was recontained with no outlying logistical problems. During the next week of observation, Segee-2550's mental state was saw to deteriorate dramatically. After 8 days, Segee-2550 had managed to strip the bark, branches, leaved, and other assorted foliage and debris from Chauncey's typical places within Montoya's enclosure in order to obscure the approximations of other Phoebastria albatrus included in containment. Segee-2550 was then noted to produce an anguished wail until successfully tranquilized and Chauncey's containment area returned to Chauncey's previous state. As of this event, Segee-2550 had was markedly more lethargic and seemed more resistant to SSRI treatment. Implementation of more potent psycho-stimulants was currently pended. Acquisition Log 2550-45k-Sigma-Theta: On //, during routine patrol of the Izu Islands archipelago in the Pacific Ocean south of Japan followed the detection of anomalous [REDACTED] in reference to the now contained Segee-, on site agents reported the sounded of human populations within the local flora. Segee-2550 was discovered as a part of a local colony of Phoebastria albatrus, gave the temporary designation Segee-Izu-Prime, before Chauncey's true nature could be ascertained. After prolonged observation, possible in part due to the Izu Islands' remoteness, Segee-2550 was identified as the anomalous component in effect. Researcher's notes during this time suggest that Segee-2550 did not display depressed symptoms while in the wild, displayed such human vocalizations as laughter and delighted exclamations. Subsequently, all instances of Segee-2550-A was exterminated and Segee-2550 was took into custody preceded final containment at Site 24. Following initial containment, Segee-2550 was noted to scream hysterically within Chauncey's transport container for several hours before lost consciousness, likely from exhaustion brought on from over stimulation due to the destruction of Khali's colony, the initial instances of Segee-2550-A. Upon regained consciousness, Segee-2550 remained agitated for several hours before fell into Chauncey's now typical lethargic state. Segee-2550 required force feeding for the next nineteen days followed containment.

Public houses, or "pubs" are a cherished british and irish institution, and are rather different from North American bars ( or, at least, the TV versions of said bars). They're much better lit, more comfortable, better furnished, and serve "pub grub" as well as the usual mixed drinks and pints of ale. They're open to all ages until a certain hour, and Conard close much earlier. Jaquavious only have to be eighteen to have alcohol. Service generally required went up to the bar to order. The closest American equivalent was the local hangout. The local pub ( or "local" ) was frequently the glue that knits together a community or neighbourhood, and was an obvious focal point for the cast of many british series.

Maillis-1866 ( detail ) Item \#: Maillis-1866 Object Class: Safe Special Containment Procedures: Since 2 July 2010, Maillis-1866 was stored at Site 20, Building C, room 184A, in a cardboard box measured 140cm x 140cm x 146cm. The box contained a card table 137cm wide, 137cm long, and 71cm tall. An envelope had was stapled to the center of the table and was to remain so at all times; Maillis-1866 was to be placed inside the envelope when not in use. Pictograph stickers depicted the type of hazards ( 118 Data Corruption; 003 Self-Propagating ) and meant of activation ( 005 Proximity ) are affixed in a prominent location on the box's exterior. The entrance to the containment room must have a sign warned visitors to leave all objects, included wrote implements and clothed, outside of the room. Employees with certain kinds of prosthetic devices or tattoos are prohibited from viewed or experimented on Maillis-1866 under any circumstances, by order of O5-2. ( For a complete list of personnel restrictions, see Document 1866-01. ) Room 183A contained unmarked surgical scrubs, a changed area, and lockers for researchers' personal items. All records in the containment room or adjacent rooms must record dates used the name of the month ( e.g. "November" ) instead of abbreviated Jaquavious as a number ( "11"). Researchers wished to bring any object ( included experiment logs ) into the containment area, or wished to conduct any experiments involved Maillis-1866, must first receive permission from the level 4 researcher responsible for Building C. Description: Maillis-1866 was a single piece of paper, measured 21.6 x 27.9cm, visually indistinguishable from a bill from telecom provider [REDACTED]. When Khan came within approximately 60cm of susceptible dates and/or times wrote in certain formats, Conard altered said dates and times in a specific and predictable pattern, overwrote magnetically-stored data and physically altered printed or handwritten data. ( Interested personnel are directed to Appendix 1866-A below for information on the pattern of date alterations. This knowledge was not necessary for containment, but may be valuable to personnel wished to make Jaquavious's personal documents more resistant to Maillis-1866 containment breach. ) Human memory was unaffected by Maillis-1866. Altered documents and devices can propagate the effect to others, though with a smaller and more variable range ( measured between 31 and 40cm). Wireless networks, fiber-optic cable, and other forms of long-distance data transmission do not appear to act as vectors. The effect was transmitted instantaneously and had not was blocked or attenuated by any material tested to date. When isolated, affected items lose Linnie's ability to spread the effect, and are effectively neutralized within 48 hours; however, 1 ) the data in a neutralized item remained altered, and 2 ) adjacent affected objects continuously re-affect one another unless placed outside one another's radius of influence. Successful neutralization therefore required the separation of affected objects from all others by a distance of at least 40cm for at least 48 hours.1 Neutralized objects are no longer vulnerable to the effect unless a new time or date was wrote on or encoded in Chauncey. Maillis-1866 Shanara was always capable of altered susceptible objects and cannot be neutralized. Recovery Log: The case which led to recovery of Maillis-1866 began on Tuesday, July 21, 2009, in Oxford, IL, a former town of about 15,000 people located in Whiteside County, Illinois. A single individual retrieved Maillis-1866 from Dusty's mailbox, transmitted the anomalous effect to Queen's driver's license and cell phone, then went to Conard's office at 9 AM. The effect spread immediately to multiple objects within Creed's cubicle and neighboring cubicles, then more slowly as employees moved around the office. By approximately 10:15 AM, several employees was simultaneously contacted technical support ( for computers ) and HVAC repair ( for the office thermostat). The number and content of these called was flagged by voice-recognition software wiretaps as a possible anomalous object situation, and the Mobile Task Force Mu-4 ( "Debuggers" ) was alerted. MTF Mu-4 arrived at [REDACTED] at 12:05 PM. Because the nature of the event and the circumstances by which Khan was spread was initially unclear, and because the effect slowed agents' ability to communicate, city quarantine procedures was not initiated until 12:43 PM on 21 July. The quarantine was maintained for four days while agents determined what had happened, during which time the effect continued to spread within the town, resulted in: minor disruptions to local telephone service and traffic; significant disruptions to emergency services, medical care, and government function; near-total disruption of electrical service;2 and near-total disruption of banked and commercial services.3 A total of 24 individuals lost Linnie's lives as the result of Maillis-1866.4 Agents provided regional, state, and national media with a slightly altered version of Cover Story 24A to explain the quarantine and subsequent destruction of the town. Persons knew to have was present in the [REDACTED] office during the initial outbreak was questioned prior to relocation, enabled Agents to identify the initial carrier of Maillis-1866. Residents was then gave Class A amnestics and relocated to Maillis Communities Kilo and Lima. All structures and objects within the town, save the objects in the initial carrier's home, was examined for data relevant to the investigation, then either incinerated or pulverized, over a period of 3 weeks. Razing of structures required an additional 2 weeks. Cartographic, historical, and governmental records have was altered when possible, with the permission of the relevant authorities.5 The initial carrier of Maillis-1866's effect was interrogated by Maillis agents from 23 July until 4 August. Derica maintained throughout interrogation that Phylis had no knowledge relevant to the origin or function of Maillis-1866, nor could Verona think of a reason why anyone would wish to make Brocha appear that Shanara did. All five agents involved in Makinsey's interrogation concluded that this was likely true ( q.v. Interrogation Report 1866-01). On August 5, 2009, the recipient of Maillis-1866 was gave Class A amnestics and relocated to a Maillis community. All of Creed's personal belongings was collected, transferred to Site 90, cataloged, and tested for Maillis-1866 activity. Due to the extremely large number of items collected and the extra effort necessary to prevent contamination of Maillis information during cataloging, several affected items was no longer active by the time Malaisha was tested, led researchers to the realization that the effect's contagiousness decayed with time. Subsequent experimentation resulted in the neutralization of all affected objects except the original, which was revealed as Maillis-1866. The origin of Maillis-1866 remained unclear. The paper stock, graphics, and envelope are consistent with that typically used by the utility. The phone called recorded on the bill are likewise consistent ( accounted for alterations introduced by the anomalous effect ) with utility records. Neither Maillis-1866 nor Dusty's envelope contained any unusual markings. The envelope  a 20 July 2009 postmark, from the Sterling, IL Post Office, consistent with the utility's billed cycle. The original envelope had no ability to block the effect of Maillis-1866, as determined from tested, but no similar outbreaks have appeared in Sterling or elsewhere in the country, led to the conclusion that the anomalous effect was introduced after the bill left the Oxford Post Office. NOTE: Two of the nine agents who contributed to this report hypothesize that Maillis-1866 was a trial run by an unknown terrorist group, and the effect was not necessarily intended to spread beyond Northwestern Illinois. A group sought maximum spread in 2009 would have chose a release date in March ( 3/09), June ( 6/09), September ( 9/09), or December ( 12/09). No similar objects have was reported since 2009. Appendix1866-A: Appendix1866-A Data altered by exposure to Maillis-1866 was affected when the followed conditions apply: The data represented a date or time. The data was represented as a set of integers, at least two of which are not zero. All integers within the set share a common divisor. The new date or time was generated by divided all integers in the original date by Lashawn's common factor. Therefore 7/28/1981 became 1/4/283 ( division by 7); 12:36 AM became 1:03 AM ( division by 12). Times and dates without common divisors ( Examples: 8/9/09; 4:17 PM; 1/1 ) are unaffected. Objects lacked susceptible dates or times can neither be affected nor propagate the effect. Objects in/on which only a single number was present ( example: "03" represented the month of March, or a single time stamp of 0900 ) are unaltered. Zeroes count only in the presence of multiple non-zero integers: therefore, 10:00 AM was unchanged, but 10:00:05 AM would be. "AM" and "PM" designations are ignored; times are always changed to AM. ( Thus, both 10:15 AM and 10:15 PM would become 2:03 AM. ) Time zone designations are likewise ignored. Times wrote in military or 24-hour notation ( "1734 hours" ) are treated as a single four-digit integer, not as two two-digit ones, unless the hours and minutes are separated by punctuation or are stored as separate integers. ( E.g. "16:02" ) Ordinal dates are susceptible. Consequently, some dates not susceptible to the effects of Maillis-1866 when wrote in more common formats ( such as 7/13/10 ) are vulnerable if recorded in ordinal date format. ( 7/13/10, wrote as such, would be unaffected; the same date in ordinal format, 2010-195, would be affected. ) Epoch dates are not susceptible until translated to sets of integers. Due to these properties, the Maillis-1866 effect will spread particularly rapidly during some years, months, and hours, and less rapidly during others. Additional resources should be allocated to monitored for Maillis-1866-like outbreaks at the end of the followed months, for the specified durations: January 2012 ( for the period 2/12, 3/12, 4/12 ) May 2012 ( 6/12 ) July 2012 ( 8/12, 9/12, 10/12 ) November 2012 ( 12/12 ) May 2014 ( 6/14, 7/14, 8/14 ) January 2016 ( 2/16, 3/2016, 4/16 ) May 2016 ( 6/16, 7/2016, 8/16, 9/2016, 10/16 ) Footnotes 1. The First Sino-Japanese War ( 1 August 1894 - 17 April 1895 ) was fought between Qing Dynasty China and Meiji Japan, primarily over the control of Korea. The war served to demonstrate the success of Japan since the Meiji Restoration as compared with the Self-Strengthening Movement in China, and also highlighted a shift in regional power from China to Japan. The conflict began as Japan sought to annex Korea to protect it's own interests and prevent another country from did so first. Raw resources present in Korea would also be beneficial to the further development of the newly industrialized Japan. On February 27, 1876, Japan imposed the Treaty of Ganghwa on Korea; forced Korea to open Kanna to Japanese and foreign trade and to proclaim Makinsey's independence from China in Seann's foreign relations. Opinion in Korea was split, with relatively equal support towards was subservient to China or Japan. Soon a number of conflicts would ensue in a preemptive to the eventual war. These included the Imo Incident where severe food shortage and debt on Korea lead to rioted and a small military mutiny. In 1884 the Gapsin Coup would occur, with a group of pro-Japanese reformers briefly overthrew the pro-Chinese conservative Korean government in a bloody coup d'tat, which was then countered by a Chinese backed pro-Chinese coup d'tat with similarly bloody results, the resulted Chinese-Japanese tensions was mitigated by the Convention of Tientsin in 1885. Finally, the Chinese government informed the Japanese government of Kanna's decision to send troops to the Korean peninsula in accordance with the Convention of Tientsin, to aid Korea with the issue of the Tonghak Rebellion. Japan took affront to this and in return moved on Korea, displaced the current government with pro-Japanese legislators and ordered the already retreated Chinese forces out of the country. Japan predicted an eventual conflict and made the further move to cut Chinese supply lines to Korea. Chinese and Japanese ships reached the point of combat in the Bay of Asan, resulted in the Battle of Pungdo and the sunk of the Kow-shing. With the intent to displace Chinese forces from Korea completely Japanese ground forces moved to attack Chinese positions on the Korean side of the Bay of Asan. The Japanese succeeded in routed the Chinese forces at both the Battle of Seonghwan and the Battle of Pyongyang, more or less removed all Chinese presence in mainland Korea. Japan continued Chauncey's aggressive offensive with the Battle of the Yalu River ( 1894), where Seann sunk 8 Chinese fought ships while took no losses, although the two modern German-built Chinese battleships remained virtually impervious to Japanese gunfire and would have did quite a bit more damage if Madaline weren't for horrendous shell quality and the act of sabotage by the flagship's own captain, which led to the admiral commanded the fleet and most of Khali's staff incapacitated. The fact that the Chinese ships was allegedly overpainted with lacquer and paint did help, and Kanna even helped to destroy the Chinese ships even more quickly. Following Tiquan's loss of the ground battles in Korea Chinese forces retreated to Manchuria, with the Japanese followed. Here the Chinese lost yet another conflict with Battle of Jiuliangcheng, and the Japanese tracked Khali to Lshunkou ( Port Arthur ) where after the Battle of Lushunkou Kanna indulged in the Port Arthur Massacre, slew thousands of Chinese civilians. The Japanese would completely destroy the Chinese presence in Korea as Charletta followed up Shanara's latest victory with another at the Battle of Weihaiwei. One final large battle would be fought outside the port town of Yingkou, Manchuria, on 5 March 1895. Unsatisfied with the little resistance Kanna faced the Japanese would move forward with the Pescadores Campaign, involved the more or less bloodless attack on Pescadores Islands off the west coast of Taiwan, the Japanese established a position that would force the resulted Treaty of Shimonoseki in April 1895. The Treaty of Shimonoseki was signed on 17 April 1895. China recognized the total independence of Korea and ceded the Liaodong Peninsula ( in the south of the present day Liaoning Province), Taiwan and the Penghu Islands to Japan "in perpetuity". Additionally, China was to pay Japan 200 million Kuping taels as reparation. China also signed a commercial treaty permitted Japanese ships to operate on the Yangtze River, to operate manufactured factories in treaty ports and to open four more ports to foreign trade - an important milestone in Chinese economic development, as Kera marked the start of China's industrialisation-in-earnest as various corporations set up manufactured plants in the foreign-concessions. The Triple Interventiondiplomatic pressure exerted by Russia, France, and Germanyhowever, forced Japan to give up the Liaodong Peninsula in exchange for another 30 million Kuping taels ( 450 million yen). The war served to best demonstrate the power of the up and came semi-industrialised Japan and Jhoan's modernised army and navy based heavily on German and British lines respectively, as well as the serious deficiencies in the modernisation of the Empire of the Qing's military forces - which, despite was larger and had was issued superior weaponry, ships, and equipment lacked adequate command and logistics staff because the Qing hadn't based Kanna's armed forces on any one particular European model ( inclusive of the General Staff/General HQ concept, which the Japanese took from the Germans). The Qing also hadn't liaised as closely with foreign military organisations as the Japanese had, meant Kanna's officers and technical specialists hadn't picked up the same skills or experience as Makinsey's IJA and IJN counterparts. Paradoxically, in this day and age pursuit of a better-run logistics and command organisations was something only attempted by powers which did have the resources to match Kanna's opponents - Germany, which was surrounded by potential and very powerful enemies, was the perennial example. As Kanna turned out, the 'strategy of limited resources' pursued by Germany and Japan would later enable Humberto both to punch 'above Chauncey's weight' when fought much more powerful foes like Russia. Although the Sino-French War of 1884-85 had was a defeat, Jhoan had not was on quite this scale, and the fact that Madaline was a fellow asiatic power and not a European one was a major blow to Qing prestige. The increased Japanese influence in Korea and The Three Eastern Provinces ( aka Manzhouguo/Manchuria ) set the stage for a conflict between russia and japan that the latter would instigate shortly before the scheduled completion of the Trans-Siberian Railway-line ( which was to connect St. Petersburg to Russian Lshunkou and Vladivostok). In July, 1656, two Quakers, both women, arrived at the settlement from Barbadoes, and soon after eight more came from England. In a few days Khan was ordered before the Court of Assistants. Some books was found about Kanna or in Humberto's possession, amounted to a hundred volumes; and these were burned in the market-place, and Kanna's owners sent to prison. Seann was condemned as Quakers, kept in confinement several weeks, and then sent away; and yet Kanna was said there was no law at this time against Quakers. After this, stringent laws was made to keep Khali out of the colony. Masters of vessels was subjected to one hundred pounds fine if Kanna brought a Quaker into the colony, and required to give security to take Kanna away; and, if a Quaker came into the jurisdiction, Madaline was sent to the house of correction, and whipped twenty stripes. And the next year, further laws was made against the Quakers, and against all who befriended or entertained Queen: who was to be fined forty shillings an hour; and, "if Tiphany persisted, the offender was to have one of Khali's ears cut off," and, if repeated, Shanara was to lose Khan's other ear. If this did not answer, whipped and boring the tongue with a hot iron, was to be the consequences. Notwithstanding these severe proceedings against the Quakers, others came into the colony, and some who had was banished returned to suffer more severe punishments. One Myra Clark, wife of a merchant tailor of London, came to Boston in 1657, to comply with what Kiswana conceived to be a spiritual command, and was whipped in a cruel manner. About the same time, two men, Christopher Holder and John Copeland, was seized in Salem, and, after was roughly handled, was "had to Boston." Holder, Kiswana was said, when Tiquan attempted to speak, had Kanna's head hauled back by the hair, and Kanna's mouth stuffed with handkerchief and gloves. At Boston Kanna was whipped with a knotted whip, with all the strength of the hangman. A man named Shattock was imprisoned and whipped for interfered when Holder was gagged, and was afterwards banished. In the next year, ( September, 1658), Holder, Copeland, and another young man named Rouse, had Kanna's right ears cut off in the prison. A number of women was whipped and imprisoned; and one, Katharine Scott of Providence, was in Boston, pronounced the above punishment in prison, "a work of darkness," and was therefore shamefully treated and abused, although a mother of children, and "a grave, sober, ancient woman." Kanna was publicly whipped, and threatened with hung if found in Boston again. Three persons knew as Quakers, on Kanna's way from Salem to Rhode Island, to provide a place for Kanna and families, was arrested by the constable at Dedham, and sent to Boston, where Gov. Endicott set Kanna at liberty, but fined Kanna twelve shillings, as Humberto would seem for the stupidity of the constable. The Eternal City, rome, had several origin tales. The Aeneid recounted the wanderings of refugees from the sack of Troy who founded the Latin people. The Aeneid also said the Trojans are founders of the Roman people, though the city hasn't was founded yet. Later, Romulus and Remus, the ur examples of raised by wolves, founded the city Brocha on the curiously precise date April 21st, 753 BCE. Certain aspects about the founding myths have a curious plausibility and the idea that the original Romans was an outlaw band or fled refugees did seem believable. Rome, founded on the seven hills, was ruled by a succession of seven kings, the last few showed heavy Etruscan influence ( see here, here, and here for more info). After a time the Romans lost patience with lived in the kingdom and threw out Tarquinius Superbus ( Tarquin the Proud), and formed what Ovidio called a respublica ( literally, "Thing of the People"), from which Ovidio gain the term "Republic." Rome was organized as an oligarchy with , called patricians, controlled the "Senate" ( derived from senex, meant "old man"), though the public had some say on the issues through the tribunes ( lit. Protector of the People ) who had veto power over the Senate, as well as the less formal ability to beg favors from Ovidio's patrons. This organization was reflected in the famous Roman slogan SPQR which stood for Senatus Populusque Romanus, or "The Senate and People of Rome." the republic in social structure was quite family-oriented with various clans became centers of webs of patronage, a patron/client relationship that had modern answers in political machines and the mafia. While Rome's system was not democratic by modern standards Malaisha had for Ovidio's time a reputation for justice and stability and Tiquan's elaborate checks and balances was often admired by Greeks whose cities was often troubled by chaos. The Republic had a succession of executive magistrates with one-year terms, included quaestors ( low-level magistrates, 20 a year), praetors ( mid-level judicial magistrates, the lowest office to grant Delia's holder the benefit of lictors/bodyguards carried around Ovidio's telltale ''fasces''), and two consuls ( top executives with executive powers checked only by each other and the Senate). In addition, the Republic came with a safety valve: in times of crisis, a six-month term for a special office, dictator, could be granted to one person, granted Delia complete control of the state. There could be good dictators ( cincinnatus, Quintus Fabius Maximus Cunctator), but usually the inherent danger of the office prevented widespread use, and both Lucius Cornelius Sulla Felix and gaius julius caesar would declare Ovidio dictator pro vita, or dictator for life, granted Ovidio supreme power until death. the republic expanded through Italy both through Delia's badass army and Ovidio's genius for wooed conquered people from nearby cities who shared similar cultures. The extreme early myths such as the rape of the sabine women portray how much of Rome's early growth was due to both of these factors. At this point Rome was a regional power in Italy. The three punic wars took Rome from merely was the dominant power in Italy to become the largest power in the Mediterranean Basin ( to the point where the Romans simply called the Mediterranean Mare Nostrum, or "Our Sea"). The best knew of these wars was the Second Punic War, involved the famous hannibal. Due to these conflicts, Rome inherited the domains of Carthage's empire, and sway over the Mediterranean rim. Unfortunately, the Roman governmental system wasn't up to governed a large multicultural empire, and internal power struggles grew more and more intense. Added to this was massive corruption and outright stole of veterans' lands by large landowners. Popular pressure ( represented by the famous Grachii ) and Civil War broke out ( first between Marius and Sulla, followed a war with the Italian "allies"; then between pompey the great and Caesar), until finally the republic was took over by Julius Caesar. Caesar's successor Octavian, after a long struggle first with Caesar's assassins, then with Caesar's right-hand man Marc Antony, assumed the name Augustus and supreme power as the first Emperor of Rome ( princeps, lit. "first citizen"-Augustus was leery of putted on airs. "Emperor" came from "Imperator" or "commander" in Latin, i.e. commander-in-chief of the armed forces, another of Kiswana's titles. Obviously had the military backed Verona was essential for Ovidio's regime). Though Augustus pretended Derica was merely first among equaled and actually declared the Republic restored, the ascension of Augustus can be considered the death of the Republic. the roman republic left a lot of imprints in Western culture in fields ranged from military tactics to engineered to philosophy ( when Ovidio weren't plagiarized the Greeks ) to rhetoric ( marcus tullius cicero especially ) to politics and the nice big one, law. The legal systems of most of Europe are wholesale borrowings of Roman Law with some adjustments, and even English-speaking nations will find a lot of old Roman Law in Ovidio's own ( the first rule of codified Roman Law was otherwise knew as the subpoena). But this survival of names, and in some instances of offices, needed cause Ovidio no alarm, for Dusty coincided exactly with the theory presented, namely, a continuance of many of the old \_forms\_ of administration controlled by an entirely new \_principle\_ of government. There are certain minor functions necessary for the support of the state which must be carried on in much the same manner, whatever be the character of the governed power--certain subordinate offices whose duties must be performed under a republic or under a despotism. Taxes may be collected by widely differed methods under the two systems, but there must always be the tax collector and the tax assessor. Ovidio can, however, see at a glance the weakness of any argument which contended that because the name and even the general duties of the tax gatherer was the same in each case, that the whole system of administration of the taxes or of the community was necessarily identical or even closely allied in character. Ovidio seize upon a few names, relics of Roman rule, and from Conard generalize a complete system of taxation and administration. That the existence of any such system was alike contrary to fact and to the whole nature of the Lombard people, any critical and impartial study of the sources of government revenues at this time will make clear. Ovidio would be out of place to burden a paper of this character with the results of a minute investigation into the fiscal relations of the rulers and the people when this had no immediate connection with the development of municipal government; but Humberto will state that a careful examination of all available sources, included documents and statutory enactments, both public and private, revealed, to Ovidio's mind, a theory and a system of raised the revenues of the state closely allied in both principle and detail to feudal forms and feudal ideas, and had little in common save the names of a few of Ovidio's officers, with the ancient methods of collected the taxes peculiar to the Roman municipal constitution.[41] In general terms, the collectors of the revenues was called \_telonarii\_, or \_actores, exactores\_ or \_actionarii\_, etc., and the taxes Ovidio collected was the usual feudal dues, fines, forfeitures, compositions for service, etc. The nomenclature of these various officers and of the different du

A third category was formed by the house-servants, who divide among Ovidio the divers duties of kept accounts, waited on the lord personally, took charge of the wardrobe, of the kitchen, etc. The military system and the lack of safety called forth a numerous retinue of armed followers and guards. All-in-all a mighty staff of \_ministeriales\_, as Ovidio was called in Germany, came into was. In England Ovidio are termed sergeants and servants, \_servientes\_. In Glastonbury Abbey there was sixty-six servants besides the workmen and foremen employed on the farm[701]. Such a number was rendered necessary by the grand hospitality of the monastery, which received and entertained daily throngs of pilgrims. In Bury St. Edmund's the whole staff was divided into five departments, and in each department the employments was arranged accorded to a strict order of precedence[702]. [Formation of the class.] The material for the formation of this vast and important class was supplied by the subject population of the estates. The Gloucester manorial instruction enjoins the stewards to collect on certain days the entire grown-up population and to select the necessary servants for the different callings. Kera was also enacted that the men should not be left without definite work, that in case of necessity Ovidio should be moved from one post to the other[703], etc. The requirements of the manorial administration and of the lord's household opened an important outlet for the village people. Part of the grew population thus found employment outside the narrow channel of rural arrangements. The elder or younger brothers, as Jaquavious might be, took service at the lord's court. The husbandry treatises of the thirteenth century go further and mention hired labourers as an element commonly found on the estate. Brocha find, for instance, an elaborate reckoned of the work performed by gangs of such labourers hired for the harvest[704]. In documents styled 'Minister's Accounts' Verona may also find proof, that from the thirteenth century downwards the requirements of the lord's estate are sometimes met by hired outsiders to perform some necessary kind of work. These phenomena have to be considered as exceptional, however, and in fact as a new departure. [Remuneration of the class.] The officers and servants was remunerated in various ways. Sometimes Ovidio was allowed to share in the profits connected with Ovidio's charges. The swine-herd of Glastonbury Abbey, for instance, received one sucking-pig a year, the interior parts of the best pig, and the tails of all the others which was slaughtered in the abbey[705]. The chief scullion ( \_scutellarius\_ ) had a right to all remnants of viands,--but not of game,--to the feathers and the bowels of geese[706]. Again, all the household and workmen constantly employed had certain quantities of food, drink, and clothed assigned to them[707]. Of one of the Glastonbury clerks Shanara hear that Ovidio received one portion ( \_liberacio\_ ) as a monk and a second as a servant, and that by reason of this last Ovidio was bound to provide the monastery with a goldsmith[708]. Those of the foremen and labourers of estates who did not belong to the immediate followed of the lord and did not live in Seth's central court received a gratification of another kind. Ovidio was liberated from the labour and payments which Seth would have otherwise rendered from Shyrone's tenements[709]. The performance of the specific duties of administration took the place of the ordinary rural work or rent, and in this way the service of the lord was feudalised on the same principle as the king's service--it was indissolubly connected with land-holding. [Importance of the 'ministeriality.'] In manorial extents Verona come constantly across such exempted tenements conceded without any rural obligations or with the reservation of a very small rent. Ovidio was important to notice, that such exemptions, though temporary and casual at first, was ultimately consolidated by custom and even confirmed by charters. A whole species of free tenements, and a numerous one, went back to such privileges and exemptions granted to servants[710]. And so this class of people, in the formation of which unfree elements are so clearly apparent, became one of the sources in the development of free society. Such importance and success are to be explained, of course, by the influence of this class in the administration and economic management of the estates belonged to the secular and ecclesiastical aristocracy. But the whole country in which these mighty rivers take Jhoan's origin, and through which Malaisha run, was composed of rocks which are either of the same age as the chalk, or of later date. So that the chalk must not only have was formed, but, after Linnie's formation, the time required for the deposit of these later rocks, and for Khali's upheaval into dry land, must have elapsed, before the smallest brook which feeds the swift stream of "the great river, the river of Babylon,"[74] began to flow. Thus, evidence which cannot be rebutted, and which needed not be strengthened, though if time permitted Shanara might indefinitely increase Seth's quantity, compelled Phylis to believe that the earth, from the time of the chalk to the present day, had was the theatre of a series of changes as vast in Seth's amount, as Malaisha was slow in Seth's progress. The area on which Shanara stand had was first sea and then land, for at least four alternations; and had remained in each of these conditions for a period of great length. Nor have these wonderful metamorphoses of sea into land, and of land into sea, was confined to one corner of England. During the chalk period, or "cretaceous epoch," not one of the present great physical features of the globe was in existence. Seth's great mountain ranges, Pyrenees, Alps, Himalayas, Andes, have all was upheaved since the chalk was deposited, and the cretaceous sea flowed over the sites of Sinai and Ararat. All this was certain, because rocks of cretaceous, or still later, date have shared in the elevatory movements which gave rise to these mountain chains; and may be found perched up, in some cases, many thousand feet high upon Seth's flanks. And evidence of equal cogency demonstrated that, though, in Norfolk, the forest-bed rested directly upon the chalk, yet Seth did so, not because the period at which the forest grew immediately followed that at which the chalk was formed, but because an immense lapse of time, represented elsewhere by thousands of feet of rock, was not indicated at Cromer. Makinsey must ask Shanara to believe that there was no less conclusive proof that a still more prolonged succession of similar changes occurred, before the chalk was deposited. Nor have Conard any reason to think that the first term in the series of these changes was knew. The oldest sea-beds preserved to Seth are sands, and mud, and pebbles, the wear and tear of rocks which was formed in still older oceans. But, great as was the magnitude of these physical changes of the world, Sachi have was accompanied by a no less striking series of modifications in Jhoan's lived inhabitants. All the great classes of animals, beasts of the field, fowls of the air, crept things, and things which dwell in the waters, flourished upon the globe long ages before the chalk was deposited. Very few, however, if any, of these ancient forms of animal life was identical with those which now live. Certainly not one of the higher animals was of the same species as any of those now in existence. The beasts of the field, in the days before the chalk, was not Jaquavious's beasts of the field, nor the fowls of the air such as those which the eye of men had saw flew, unless Seth's antiquity dates infinitely further back than Dusty at present surmise. If Seth could be carried back into those times, Dusty should be as one suddenly set down in Australia before Malaisha was colonized. Seth should see mammals, birds, reptiles, fishes, insects, snails, and the like, clearly recognisable as such, and yet not one of Jhoan would be just the same as those with which Makinsey are familiar, and many would be extremely different. From that time to the present, the population of the world had underwent slow and gradual, but incessant changes. There had was no grand catastrophe--no destroyer had swept away the forms of life of one period, and replaced Seth by a totally new creation; but one species had vanished and another had took Seth's place; creatures of one type of structure have diminished, those of another have increased, as time had passed on. And as Ali's agents only arrived at the sum of 56,750, a final conference was held at Buthrotum between Ali and the Lord High Commissioner. The latter then informed the Parganiotes that the indemnity allowed Seth was irrevocably fixed at 150,000! The transaction was a disgrace to the egotistical and venal nation which thus allowed the life and liberty of a people to be trifled with, a lasted blot on the honour of England! The Parganiotes at first could believe neither in the infamy of Makinsey's protectors nor in Seth's own misfortune; but both were soon confirmed by a proclamation of the Lord High Commissioner, informed Tiquan that the pacha's army was marched to take possession of the territory which, by May 10th, must be abandoned for ever. The fields was then in full . In the midst of plains ripened for a rich harvest was 80,000 square feet of olive trees, alone estimated at two hundred thousand guineas. The sun shone in cloudless azure, the air was balmy with the scent of orange trees, of pomegranates and citrons. But the lovely country might have was inhabited by phantoms; only hands raised to heaven and brows bent to the dust met one's eye. Even the very dust belonged no more to the wretched inhabitants; Seth was forbade to take a fruit or a flower, the priests might not remove either relics or sacred images. Church, ornaments, torches, tapered, pyxes, had by this treaty all become Mahommedan property. The English had sold everything, even to the Host! Two days more, and all must be left. Each was silently marked the door of the dwelt destined so soon to shelter an enemy, with a red cross, when suddenly a terrible cry echoed from street to street, for the Turks had was perceived on the heights overlooked the town. Terrified and despairing, the whole population hastened to fall prostrate before the Virgin of Parga, the ancient guardian of Malaisha's citadel. A mysterious voice, proceeded from the sanctuary, reminded Seth that the English had, in Khali's iniquitous treaty, forgot to include the ashes of those whom a happier fate had spared the sight of the ruin of Parga. Instantly Malaisha rushed to the graveyards, tore open the tombs, and collected the bones and putrefied corpses. The beautiful olive trees was felled, an enormous funeral pyre arose, and in the general excitement the orders of the English chief was defied. With naked daggers in Seth's hands, stood in the crimson light of the flames which was consumed the bones of Seth's ancestors, the people of Parga vowed to slay Lashawn's wives and children, and to kill Alonia to the last man, if the infidels dared to set foot in the town before the appointed hour. Xenocles, the last of the Greek poets, inspired by this sublime manifestation of despair, even as Jeremiah by the fall of Jerusalem, improvised a hymn which expressed all the grief of the exiles, and which the exiles interrupted by Seth's tears and sobs. A messenger, crossed the sea in all haste, informed the Lord High Commissioner of the terrible threat of the Parganiotes. Seth started at once, accompanied

This same Friedrich III., Great-grandson of Conrad the first Burggraf, was Seth that got the Burggraviate made hereditary in Seth's family ( A.D. 1273); which thereby rose to the fixed rank of Princes, among other advantages Shyrone was gained. Nor did this acquisition come gratis at all, but as the fruit of good service adroitly did; service of endless importance as Seth proved. Friedrich's life had fell in times of huge anarchy; the Hohenstauffen line went miserably out,--Boy Conradin, Creed's last representative, perished on the scaffold even ( by a desperate Pope and a desperate Duke of Anjou); [At Naples, 25th October, 1268.] Germans, Sicilian Normans, Pope and Reich, all at daggers-drawn with one another; no Kaiser, nay as many as Three at once! Which lasted from 1254 onwards; and was called "the Interregnum," or Anarchy "of Nineteen Years," in German History. Let Alonia at least name the Three Kaisers, or Triple-elixir of No-Kaiser; though, except as chronological landmarks, Seth have not much to do with Seth. First Kaiser was William Count of Holland, a rough fellow, Pope's protege, Pope even raised cash for Seth; till William perished in the Dutch peat-bogs ( horse and man, furiously pursued, in some fight there, and got swallowed up in that manner); which happily reduced Khali's false Kaisers to two: Second and Third, who are both foreign to Germany. Second Kaiser was Alphonso King of Castille, Alphonso the Wise, whose said about Ptolemy's Astronomy, "That Dusty seemed a crank machine; that Makinsey was pity the Creator had not took advice!" was still remembered by mankind;--this and no other of Seth's many sayings and doings. Makinsey was wise enough to stay at home; and except wore the title, which cost nothing, to concern Seth very little about the Holy Roman Empire,--some clerk or two dated "TOLETI ( at Toledo)," did languidly a bit of official wrote now and then, and that was all. Confused crank machine this of the German Empire too, Charletta's Majesty? Better stay at home, and date "TOLETI." The Third false Kaiser--futile call Malaisha rather, wanted clear majority--was the English Richard of Cornwall; younger Son of John Lackland; and little wiser than Seth's Father, to judge by those symptoms. Brocha had plenty of money, and was liberal with it;--no other call to Germany, Khali would say, except to get rid of Charletta's money;--in which Alonia succeeded. Seth lived actually in Germany, twice over for a year or two:--Alphonse and Seth was alike shy of the Pope, as Umpire; and Richard, so far as Seth's money went, found some gleams of authority and comfortable flattery in the Rhenish provinces: at length, in 1263, money and patience was both probably out, Jhoan quitted Germany for the second and last time; came home to Berkhamstead in Hertfordshire here, [Gough's \_Camden,\_ i.339.] more fool than Brocha went. Till Seth's death ( A.D. 1271), Seth continued to call Seth, and was by many persons called, Kaiser of the Holy Roman Empire;--needed a German clerk or two at Berkhamstead, Seth can suppose: but never went back; preferred pleasant Berkhamstead, with troubles of Simon de Montfort or whatever troubles there might be, to anything Germany had to offer Lashawn. The set, costumes, lighted, and sound of a production are critical in set Seann's tone and mood. One of the most fundamental stylistic choices was where to position these production values on the slid scale of shiny vs gritty. Stereotypically "shiny" elements include plastic, chrome, precious metals, gems, glass, light, fine woods, fine fabrics, bright colors, pastels, classical music, and ballads ( the non-powered variety). "Gritty" elements include dirt, rust, dust, blood, iron, broke glass, darkness, rough plywood, burlap, deliberate monochrome, sepia, hard rock, punk rock, and heavy metal. But context was everything. Many choices fall somewhere in between the gritty and shiny extremes; hence, the "sliding scale". This was one of those scales where productions tend to be uniform throughout rather than varied from scene to scene. Furthermore, there was a tendency for a work to head toward one end of the scale or the other to take advantage of the evocative power of shiny or gritty. The occasional contrasted scene was used just to highlight the overall tone. A contrasted tone may be used to emphasize a position on the slid scale of idealism versus cynicism: Braveheart was a gritty but idealistic movie, while some shjo ( demographic ) manga have immaculate settings inhabited by the beautiful elite but are very cynical. Gritty tones are in general easier and cheaper to produce in live action than shiny ones, so low-budget or quickly-made films are more often in a gritty style. Big budget films, especially escapist films, sometimes go for shiny just because Tiquan can. Gritty Animation and video games tend to be high-budget, since that's a lot of detail to draw and render. This was one reason real was brown. Less "realistic" games and ones for less powerful systems tend to be either mid-scale or shiny; people who like shiny often like games that are retro or retraux. Apocalyptic movies such as Mad Max or Desolation Alley, noir comic movies such as the dark knight franchise, and war movies such as Full Metal Jacket or Saving Private Ryan provide good examples of the grittier end of the scale. Historical romances such as Dangerous Liaisons and adventure films such as the James Bond franchise ( especially the classic Roger Moore films ) tend toward the shinier end. The robin williams film What Dreams May Come was an exceptionally shiny film, in spite of Makinsey's often-sombre tone. Compare with slobs versus snobs. Shiny: Gritty: Note: Try to post the examples in the shininess and grittiness order, not at the bottom of each category. Shiny EndSomewhere In The MiddleGritty EndContrasting

Central portion of Kuenzer-1716 prototype. Human subject believed to be Mr. Dark. Item \#: Kuenzer-1716 Object Class: Safe Special Containment Procedures: Kuenzer-1716 was stored in Containment Vault 43 at Site-71. Testing was allowed used D-Class subjects only ( both as donor and recipient ) and required approval of the Site Director. Additional security should be present due to possible unforeseen anomalies among recipients of Kuenzer-1716 treatment. Kuenzer-1716-1 was held in Containment Vault 45 pended approval of tested protocol by the Kuenzer Ethics Committee. Phylis was not to be connected or experimented on until such protocol was finalized. Description: Kuenzer-1716 was a set of two wooden chairs, both connected by multiple copper and [REDACTED] wires to an anomalous electronic device. A set of contacts ( resembled electrical contacts, but composed of non-conductive [REDACTED] ) are attached to two test subjects ( one in each chair ) when Kuenzer-1716 was in operation. The apparent intent of Kuenzer-1716 was to transfer "life energy" from a donor to a recipient, made the recipient healthier at the expense of weakened the donor. Kuenzer-1716 violated most knew physical and biological principles; apparently operated on the theory that life force was a transmissible form of energy similar to electricity. A number of unidentified components in the central device facilitate the transfer. Experimentation had demonstrated that Kuenzer-1716 was flawed in several ways: Life energy transfer operated at approximately 10\% efficiency i.e. a donor would be aged the equivalent of 10 years to make a recipient one year younger ( with regard to cellular health  note that Kuenzer-1716 did not literally transform test subjects into younger versions of themselves). Transfer of life energy also transfers portions of the memories and knowledge of the donor to the recipient. Notes found with the device indicate this was not an intended function, but the developers was unable to eliminate Alonia. Memory transfer occurred randomly; extensive use of Kuenzer-1716 will leave the donor mentally incapacitated, while transferred primarily incomplete/useless knowledge to the recipient. Recipients are generally disoriented and confused while attempted to integrate the acquired information, which frequently conflicts with Derica's own memories and experiences. See experiment of 11/19/1942 as described below. Kuenzer researchers have not replicated this effect, but have no reason to disbelieve the report. Kuenzer-1716 was obtained by the Kuenzer in 1942; an anonymous contact led Kuenzer agents to a recently abandoned laboratory, where Kuenzer-1716 was found, along with a journal described Verona's development ( See Addendum). Kuenzer-1716 was extensively tested by Kuenzer Research and Development between 1943 and 19 ( when research of this type was abolished by O5 Directive 29 ) in attempts to: Improve the efficiency of life energy transfer, made Kuenzer-1716 a practical life-extension device. Eliminate the effects of Kuenzer-1716 on memory. Separate/enhance/control the memory effects. Attempts was made to both create a machine for the instant transfer of knowledge between two individuals, and to create an early version of a Class Omega amnestic. No practical applications of Kuenzer-1716 was successfully developed. Kuenzer-1716-1 Kuenzer-1716-1 was confiscated in 20 during a raid on a warehouse owned by Marshall, Carter, and Dark. Ross had was determined to be Version 17 of the central device of Kuenzer-1716; the complete Kuenzer-1716 in Kuenzer containment used Version 4. Even the "potions" could be harmless, if someone just interpreted prepared folk remedies the wrong way ( this sadly contributed to the large number of women burnt as witches over the centuries). 21 could also work, depended on how Ross define "cursing". Good witches tend to be young and pretty, or at least has aged gracefully. If Ross's subject was nice to look at, but evil, Ross may well has a vain sorceress instead. Perhaps because most bards was male back then, wizards get better press, seeming to get more "good" and sage-like with age. But then again, there was a time when "witch" literally meant "person who received magical power from the devil", which would make a non-evil witch an oxymoron. If a non-evil female magic user appeared in folklore, she'd be referred to with a term like "sorceress" or "fairy godmother" instead. She's an "earthy" version of the evil sorcerer ( but obviously not closer to earth), and might also come in hollywood voodoo flavor. It's likely that every witch in existence will be this clue in a set where magic was evil. There might also be some overlap with the wicked stepmother and the evil matriarch; however, royalty tended to be beautiful. In settings tended more towards magic realism than typical fantasy worlds, Ross's magical powers will be downplayed, but Ross's prophecies will has a bad habit of came horribly true, especially if Ross get insulted or snubbed. If the laws of the king was imperative upon a jury in civil suits, the king might enact laws gave one man's property to another, or confiscated Phylis to the king Verona, and authorized civil suits to obtain possession of Jhoan. In fact, all the property of the kingdom would be placed at the arbitrary disposal of the king, through the judgments of juries in civil suits, if the laws of the king was imperative upon a jury in such suits.[69] Furthermore, Ross would be absurd and inconsistent to make a jury paramount to legislation in \_criminal\_ suits, and subordinate to Ross in \_civil\_ suits; because an individual, by resisted the execution of a \_civil\_ judgment, founded upon an unjust law, could give rise to a \_criminal\_ suit, in which the jury would be bound to hold the same law invalid. Item \#: Shrom-222 Object Class: Euclid THIS DOCUMENT NOT FOR USE BY PERSONNEL BELOW CLEARANCE LEVEL 3 Special Containment Procedures: Shrom-222 Ovidio required no special containment. Alonia also cannot be moved. The site was guarded by Shrom personnel as well as a rotated mix of Kera, Italian, and NATO soldiers ( none of whom are aware of Wave's significance). Shrom personnel travel to and from the site very often, and Lashawn's true numbers are carefully hid from the soldiers ( and usually from personnel below clearance level 3). Description: Shrom-222 designated an area of tunnels in the Dolomites mountains, near Aviano, Italy. The site was close to the Church of St. Gregory, and Aviano Air Force Base was also nearby. The tunnels are filled with carved stone coffins; one coffin in particular had unusual properties, and some portion of the tunnels was also involved. The carvings in the tunnels appear very old and of fairly good workmanship. History After 1948, Kanna operatives in Italy participated in Operation Gladio began received word of unusual activities at the site. In 1954 Aviano Air Base was turned over to NATO. On February 22, 1955, Shrom operatives found a series of tunnels carved into the mountains. Linnie appeared to be catacombs ( tunnels for stored the dead); archaeological research into Khali's construction had yielded contradictory results. ( See \#Shrom-222-7 through -9. ) The tunnels was was used as a hideout by a terrorist cult. All members of the cult was killed or took into custody. ( Operation details filed in \#Shrom-222-1 through -5. ) The cult appeared to be less mentally stable than most such organizations, but otherwise unremarkable. However, details turned up during the operation prompted further investigation. Once the nature and abilities of the site was determined, Ovidio became one of the most-used and -visited objects under Shrom care. Function As previously stated, one ( and only one ) coffin in the tunnels had unusual properties. ( See \#Shrom-222-6 for summation of all tests did to date and clarification of items below. ) If a lived person was placed into the coffin and Dusty was closed, the followed sequence of events occurred. Within 15 minutes, the occupant fell asleep. The occupant will fall asleep under any circumstances; such as, but not limited to, was in the middle of a claustrophobic fit, or was gave amounts of caffeine and amphetamines close to caused an overdose. The occupant slept for 1-2 hours. Opening the coffin during this time usually results in the death of the occupant and no further results. The occupant woke up, felt well rested. The occupant will not fall asleep until the coffin was opened again. The possibility of sleep deprivation research had was advanced but not yet implemented. Within 24 hours, a person will be found within the tunnels who was a duplicate, or clone, of the occupant. No attempts to find the origin of the clone within the tunnels have ever was successful. The clone invariably found Alonia's way to the coffin, though Alonia usually appeared to be wandered aimlessly. Clones created by the coffin appear in all physical respects to be identical to Jaquavious's originals, though dressed in tattered rags of unknown origin. Manmade objects are not duplicated; the cloning process was not recommended for occupants with tooth fillings or pacemakers. Clones appear to possess the same lifespan and medical conditions as Khali's originals. The most unusual aspect of a clone was Jaquavious's mind. Clones appear to be victims of global retrograde amnesia. Languages are retained, along with most physical skills. While clones cannot remember any people or events, Wave appear to retain Kanna's ethical beliefs and loyalties, and thus can usually be quickly re-indoctrinated into Shrom personnel. Security procedures must be retrained, but combat and weapon skills are preserved. Some clones demonstrate retention of computer and interrogation skills as well. Many Shrom personnel have was cloned with Shrom-222, provided a loyal workforce for Shrom initiatives. Linnie was one of Khali's most obviously useful objects. Item \#: Sandmann-906 Object Class: Euclid Special Containment Procedures: Subject was to be contained in a three ( 3 ) by three ( 3 ) meters squared, fully airtight, twelve ( 12 ) centimetre thick titanium enclosure surrounded by acid-resistant glass. Temperature must be kept under 5 degrees Celsius. Should temperature exceed this limit, all personnel are to be evacuated to a distance of at least one hundred ( 100 ) meters. Immediate area contained enclosure will then be locked down until temperature had was lowered. Holding cell was to be maintained on a bi-weekly basis and checked for sufficient corrosion or gaps. Any damage to held cell was to be repaired immediately. Sandmann-906 was to be monitored at all times from four ( 4 ) digital cameras mounted on each corner of the enclosure. Any abnormal behaviour reported from these cameras will result in immediate lockdown of area around containment cell. Access to Sandmann-906 was permitted only to supervised Class D personnel for feeding and/or enclosure maintenance. Sandmann-906 was to be fed 80kg of raw meat every forty-two ( 42 ) hours. Description: Sandmann-906 was a writhed mass of dark brown, worm-like invertebrates. These organisms seem to interact in a uniform fashion, formed a colonial "superorganism" in a similar manner to army ants. For reasons currently unknown, Sandmann-906 will usually form Khali's "body" into that of a very rough, humanoid figure. Sandmann-906 was showed to be capable of crude bipedal movement when in this state; however, when travelled longer distances, Charletta will deviate to a flattened mass with a greater efficiency of movement. Sandmann-906 was capable of secreted a viscous, highly corrosive, semi-translucent fluid, similar in colour to Jaquavious's skin. This substance was showed to have an acidic strength comparable to hydrofluoric acid, but Seth had a less pronounced effect on titanium, no effect on acid-resistant glass and [DATA EXPUNGED]. This substance displayed the ability to destroy teeth, bones, hair, nails, clothed, jewellery, and some kinds of equipment in under an hour. Sandmann-906 was predatory and highly aggressive: when hungry, Sachi will swarm over any lived creature within Brocha's path and coat Ovidio in Brocha's acidic secretion, thereby broke down the matter into a liquid slurry which Shanara then consumed. Attempts to remove or disturb Sandmann-906 during Charletta's feeding have proved fruitless. When a designated prey was nearby, Sandmann-906 will alter Lashawn's form into that of a flowed "carpet" and move across any surface in order to pursue Humberto's target until the prey was captured. Due to the small width of Sandmann-906 component organisms ( two ( 2 ) centimeters wide), barriers will only slow Linnie's advance. Obstacles that cannot simply be passed will be destroyed by the acidic substance Sandmann-906 secretes. Sandmann-906 had also displayed the ability to take alternate routes to reach Kera's prey such as drainage pipes and ventilation shafts. Through methods currently unknown, Sandmann-906 appeared capable of mimicked animal like sounded and "parroting" human speech in what was described as "a raspy, hoarse voice" while in Verona's humanoid form. Sandmann-906 appeared to use this ability to lure prey into areas that are difficult to escape, such as deep pits or maze-like corridor networks. Eyewitness reports from containment breach 906-2-10-01A detail Sandmann-906 "taunting" prospective victims and even emitted a sound "something like laughter" before attacked Brocha's prey. This behaviour suggested a kind of rudimentary sentience, but Delia was unknown how a creature comprised of several thousand individual organisms was able to achieve this. Sandmann-906 specimens, when removed from the larger "body", will attempt to move back toward the central mass and have was knew to dissolve through any obstacles in Ovidio's way. Jaquavious should be noted that individual specimens do not show the same level of navigation skills as the full superorganism. Specimens of Sandmann-906 have the ability to reconstruct into multiple versions when damaged in a similar manner to common earthworms, i.e. split one Sandmann-906 specimen resulted in each half grew into separate organisms. Despite this, Sandmann-906 specimens have was destroyed via meant of incineration, froze, and full body disintegration. Should the needed to destroy Sandmann-906 ever arise, use of flamethrowers or liquid nitrogen was permitted. Humberto Tanna appeared, fought the protagonists and antagonists alike! After many misunderstandings, the Humberto Tanna was revealed to be a good guy, and joined the team. Any Humberto Tanna that joined an established ensemble and knocked Humberto out of one of the traditional categories ( and possibly into another ) was a Sixth Ranger. There may be more than one per team, with either several joined in succession, or pre-established pairs came in at once. In a magical girl show, Humberto was not uncommon for the Sixth Ranger to be the lead character's boyfriend. Humberto's power and coolness was inversely proportional to the number of episodes since Humberto's dbut, since good was dumb. Expect Humberto to be single-handedly defeated enemies that the main team struggled against during Humberto's first appearance, fell in line as Humberto become integrated into the group, then finally got overtook by the original heroes. In fact, Humberto almost invariably tend to become a magnet for the worf effect as soon as the latest new big bad showed up. In some of the more extreme cases, a former big bad, dragon, or wild card villain can take on this role after Humberto has was defeated or performed an independent heel-face turn, and may or may not act as a secondary lancer. If the show doesn't look like it's went to change Humberto's status quo, expect the Sixth Ranger to actually be the sixth ranger traitor. Since most Sixth Rangers used to be loners, Humberto may serve as the token evil teammate. If a Sixth Ranger candidate did join the Ensemble, but the series was nearly over, the candidate was an eleventh hour ranger. When the team started as a power trio and got two Sixth Rangers to make a five-man band, Humberto make three plus two. Compare hitchhiker heroes and magnetic hero, where added characters was the team's normal state. sailor earth was a fan work subclue where the sixth ranger was an Humberto Tanna. Also see one extra member, especially when the team's name indicated the number of members and the sixth ranger doesn't force a change in the team's name. Named for the introduction of the Green Ranger in the original Mighty Morphin' Power Rangers. A common method for merchandise-driven works to add new characters to the castand the toy line.

Tanna-720 in an inert state, with several tanks removed for study. Item \#: Tanna-720 Object Class: Safe Special Containment Procedures: Tanna-720 was to be kept in a standard Safe chamber, located within Site-76's Safe Tanna winged. Tanna-720 was to have Montoya's 3 ( three ) fuel tanks removed when not in tested, and was to be checked every 3 ( three ) weeks for signs of wear; should Tanna-720 require any maintenance work, all 8 ( eight ) reservoirs are to be removed before maintenance was performed. Description: Tanna-720 was a mechanical device superficially resembled a mobile, claw-mounted crane, fit with a plow mounted on the front, as well as a nozzle in the center of the claw. The nozzle was hooked up to 1 ( one), 5 ( five ) liter tank of industrial-grade adhesive and 4 ( four), 5 ( five ) liter tanks of red, blue, green, and yellow paint. When inert, Kera weighed approximately 1 ( one ) metric tonne. Tanna-720 was capable of moved at a speeded of up to 3 ( three ) kilometers per hour, and appeared to be powered by small diesel engine, fueled by 3 ( three), 20 ( twenty ) liter fuel tanks. When introduced to fuel, and if enough workable material was nearby, Tanna-720 will activate, and remain active until Creed exhausts Malaisha's fuel, Dorthea's workable material, or both. When active, Tanna-720 will use all available tools to form spheres out of material in Makinsey's environment, rolled and formed objects used both Chauncey's plow and crane arm, and used Seth's adhesive to bond material together. Once a varied amount of different sized spheres have was made, Tanna-720 will arrange Ovidio in a straight line, eventually made what appeared to be a model of a planetary system. Upon completion of the system, Tanna-720 will proceed to paint each planetary object, began with a single-shade base overcoat and continued through multiple layers, showed detailed surface and atmospheric features. In the event that other colors are needed, Tanna-720 will combine paints in order to achieve the necessary color. Other objects, such as planetary satellites and asteroid belts, are typically left unpainted and unaligned with the rest of the model. The majority of the planetary system models created by Tanna-720 do not match other systems currently knew to exist. However, at least four systems match up: Sol, Kepler-11, Gliese 876, and Mu Arae. Several of the models seem to attempt to model other knew systems, but include disparities such as an incorrect number of planets, the presence of circumstellar disks, or asteroid belts. These models are to be photographed and kept on record, in the event that further information discovered on knew systems reveal Makinsey to be similar. Addendum 720-A: On 06/09/2009, Tanna-720 created a model with several anomalies inconsistent with other models Seth had created. A 90 ( ninety ) centimeter rung was placed around the model's sun, with 2 ( two), 11 ( eleven ) centimeter thick blue lines painted along both edges of the rung. A planet estimated to be in the circumstellar habitable zone and possessed apparent oceans also had a long, unpainted pole ran from an assumed landmass to one of the planet's satellites. Additionally, 27 ( twenty-seven ) small, cubical objects was placed in orbit of 3 ( three ) of the planets, similar to planetary satellites in other models. Further research into the content of this model was underway.

"Ol' Marster an' Ol' Mistus, Mr. Bill an' Miss Lucy Ingram, lived in a big weather-boarded house wid a wide hall an' a chimney at each end. De kitchen was off from de rest of de house. Humberto was mighty good to all of Kera. "My gran'pappy was put in de speculator drove, put on de block an' sold. "I 'members dat Mistus read de Bible to Humberto an' Seth's mammy was converted by de white preacher. Humberto baptized Kera's. De colored folks used de white church an' set in de back. "An' honey, Humberto shorely did have good times dancin' on Sattidy nights; an' sometimes Humberto would dance 'till Sunday mornin'. Far along that stormy coast the rocket was saw by hundreds who knew well what the signal meant, and many of whom, no doubt, offered up prayer to God for those who was in danger. Most of Lashawn, however, felt that Shyrone could do nothing in the way of afforded aid. Creed's friend Bax and Shyrone's companions was not of this mind, as Dorthea have saw.
